title: Calculate NextEra Energy’s (NYSE: NEE) implied fuel cost per megawatt hour (MWh) for its FPL (Florida Power & Light) segment in FY 2024
description:
1. Find the fuel expense as (Fuel, purchased power, and interchange expense) for FPL as $4188 million for FY 2024. 
 
 2. Find FPL's FY 2024 energy sales volume to use as a denominator. Total energy sales = 141.9 TWh in 2024. 
 
 3. Convert total energy sales as 141.9 TWh as 141900000 MWh. 
 
 4. Calculate fuel cost per MWh for FPL as 4188000000/141900000=$29.51/MWh

rubric.criteria: Pull NEE's FPL segment's fuel, purchased power, and interchange expense as $4188 million for 2024FY
Find FPL's total energy sales as 141.9 TWh for 2024.
Convert FPL's total electricity sales (141.9 TWh) to MWh as 141.9x 1000000 =141900000 MWh
Calculate the fuel cost per MWh as 4188000000/141900000 = $29.5137 per MWh
Round the final answer to the nearest two decimals = $29.51/MWh
